feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 26 at 1:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Walker, western Tuscaloosa and southeastern Fayette Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oakman to 8 miles south of Bankston. Movement was southeast at 5 mph.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cullman County through 815 PM CDT... entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 5:31PM MST until June 26 at 7:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 531 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported water starting to flow over the Bush Highway. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area which has the potential to keep area washes flowing.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:57AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot Temperatures Through Monday... * Noticeably warmer temperatures and less cloud cover arrive today. entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 26 at 4:16PM PDT until June 26 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Hot conditions will persist this afternoon and into this evening before onshore flow starts to transport cooler air into the area overnight tonight, allowing for overnight temperatures to recede back into the upper 50s. * WHERE...North Coast and Central Coast.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued June 26 at 4:16PM PDT until June 27 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Hot conditions with high temperatures in the low to mid 90s again on Monday. Overnight low temperatures tonight will likely only cool into the 60s for many locations. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Washington.
